title: The Convex Peano Curve Does Exist
abstract:
We refer here to the surprising construction made by Giuseppe Peano in 1890.
He gave an example of a continuous function (called now the Peano curve) from
the unit interval to the whole unit square. We show here the existence of a
more general space-filling curve with additional convexity properties. More
precisely: by T ? R2 we denote a convex closed and bounded set and we show that
there exists a continuous surjection f : [0; 1] 7! T for which the image of any
interval is a convex set.
